info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 2:20PM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed winter precipitation continuing. Freezing rain mixed with sleet and some light snow will continue to be possible across the region through 6 pm. Additional ice accumulations will be mainly less than one tenth of an inch through 6 pm this evening. Some light snow accumulation will be possible across elevated areas of Southeast Oklahoma as well later tonight. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Oklahoma, southwest Arkansas and northeast Texas. * WHEN...Through 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
